results.title: The Energy crisis
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Review: 26th year”.
An examination of how Britain’s way of life was affected by the patterns of energy supply. The film makes a forecast for the future.

results.title: The End of St Petersburg = Konyets Sankt-Peterburga [DVD]
results.brief_description: Originally made to commemorate the tenth year of the overthrow of Czarist Russia, Pudovkin’s film tells the story of a peasant boy who comes to St. Petersburg in search of work and witnesses the October Revolution. Set against the background of the historical events which culminated in the attack on the Winter Palace, the film contains graphic anti-war statements and was so realistically shot, that some interpreted the footage as documentary evidence of real events. Despite numerous crowd scenes, Pudovkin focuses on the struggle of the individual to relay the concerns of a people. Contains striking black and white cinematography, and expressionistic performances from Alexander Chistyakov and Vera Baranovska. Based on the poem, “The Bronze horseman” by Pushkin and the novel “St Petersburg” by Andrev Biely.

results.title: The Emperor and the abbot
results.creator_credit: Sebastian Robinson, Barry Levinson and Hemisphere Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storybook International”.
An unkind Emperor decides that the local Abbot is enjoying his life too much and gives him three almost impossible riddles to solve. A shepherd comes to the rescue of the Abbot and saves him from humiliation. A French/Austrian tale.

results.title: The Emily Rodda video
results.creator_credit: Mark Waters, Christine McCaul Gleitzman and Insight Profile
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Emily Rodda became a writer by accident. One night, she made up a story for her daughter about a young girl and her experiences throughout the day. Her daughter asked her to repeat the story the following night. Using everyday examples, Emily explains that anyone can be a writer. She shares her thoughts on how to develop small ideas based on simple objects, people and situations - into large ones, and then how to extend on these ideas to create a novel, using what she calls, the simple spell. The simple spell is just two words: What if?

results.title: The Emerging eskimo
results.creator_credit: Brayton-Kendall Productions and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Documentary film showing the effect of colonisation on the Eskimo socio-culture. Since the first arrival of the Europeans, the selling potential of Alaskan resources was quickly realised. This caused devastating damage to ecological aspects vital to Eskimo survival. In addition tho this, the film shows how colonial influence has caused ruptures in Eskimo tradition and religion.

results.title: The Eleven Powers
results.creator_credit: Frank Heimans, Larry Gartenstein and Cinetel Productions
results.brief_description: In 1979, the Festival of the Eleven Powers took place on the island of Bali. The festival is called into being every 100 years to mark the closing of the Balinese century and re-establish the balance of the positive and negative forces in the world. Over two million people took part in the sixty days of purification and religious fervour. Script by Bryce Courtenay and narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: The Elements of composition
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Nina Collier and Dynamic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music for Young People”.
Defines and explains melody, harmony, rhythm and counterpoint to a young audience. Each element is illustrated by the New York Woodwind Quintet. The film emphasises that melody is full of character, the addition of harmony makes music complete, rhythm is of many kinds and can be felt and listening to counterpoint is like following a conversation. Summarises and contrasts the elements of composition through the playing of a harmonic, rhythmic and contrapuntal treatment of the melody. Script by Lydia Perera
